oai_dc:dc.dc:title: First record of the invasive mosquito species Aedes koreicus (Diptera, Culicidae) in the Republic of Kazakhstan
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Andreeva, Yulia V.
Khrabrova, Natalia V.
Alekseeva, Svetlana S.
Abylkassymova, Gulnar M.
Simakova, Anastasia V.
Sibataev, Anuarbek K.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: invasion biology
invasive mosquito species
Aedes koreicus
Culicidae
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: <jats:p>The natural distribution range of <jats:italic>Aedes koreicus</jats:italic> is Korea, China, Japan, and the Russian Far East. Since 2008, this species has been recorded as an invasive species in some European countries (Belgium, European Russia, Germany, Hungary, Italy, Slovenia, and Switzerland). The invasive mosquito species <jats:italic>Ae. koreicus</jats:italic> is reported from the Republic of Kazakhstan for the first time. Its morphological identification was confirmed by molecular-genetic analyses of ND4 sequences using specific primers. <jats:italic>Aedes koreicus</jats:italic> larvae were found in an artificial water reservoir together with the larvae of <jats:italic>Culiseta longiareolata</jats:italic> and <jats:italic>Culex pipiens</jats:italic> s.l. <jats:italic>Aedes koreicus</jats:italic> successfully overwintered in Almaty at low winter temperatures in 2018â€“2019. This suggests that the <jats:italic>Ae. koreicus</jats:italic> acclimation capacity is greater than it has been considered until now. We assume that <jats:italic>Ae. koreicus</jats:italic> will spread over the west and south of the Republic of Kazakhstan and territories of Kyrgyzstan and Uzbekistan Republics bordering the Almaty region.</jats:p>
